action.action-desc: Mr. Ryan (for himself, Mr. Lawler, and Mr. Gottheimer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To direct the Comptroller General of the United States to conduct a study on grocery costs to United States consumers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lower Grocery Prices Act.

section.header: GAO study on grocery costs to U.S. consumers

subsection.text: The Comptroller General of the United States shall conduct a study on the changes in the Consumer Price Index for food at home for the 20-year period ending on the date of the enactment of this Act, including such other relevant economic metrics as may be necessary to assess the impact of food at home costs on United States consumers.
Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit a report to the appropriate committees of Congress that contains—

paragraph.text: the Comptroller General’s findings from the study conducted under subsection (a); and
the Comptroller General’s recommendations to help lower food at home costs for United States consumers.

subsection.text: In this Act, the term appropriate committees of Congress means the following committees:

paragraph.text: The Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives.
The Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives.
The Committee on Finance of the Senate.
